posts.title: Elon Musk sued by Wisconsin attorney general ahead of state election - CBS Minnesota
top_comments:
In another article

> Wisconsin Attorney General Josh Kaul sued Musk in state court, seeking to temporarily restrain Musk from further promoting his promise to give away two $1 million checks or making any further payments to Wisconsin voters. Wisconsin law prohibits offering anything of value to an elector in order to induce their voting behavior, Kaul said in the Dane County Circuit Court lawsuit.
“The Wisconsin Department of Justice is committed to ensuring that elections in Wisconsin are safe, secure, free, and fair,” Kaul said in a statement on X.

Like holy cow can someone please charge this man with election interference.
Cool. Now, convict and JAIL THIS MOTHERFUCKER.

This is exactly why billionaires shouldn't exist. There is nothing respectable or admirable about this, there is no advanced strategy or genius-level 4D Chess, absolutely no hard work is going into any of these victories, they are simply throwing money at the problem like always and it always works for them cause they keep us destitute.
Remember what life was like before this piece of shit was front and center in the news every fucking day? That was nice.

Unfortunately we’ve already seen the ultra wealthy can’t be held accountable because they can just delay delay delay forever.

Good luck to them either way.
I don't understand why we're "suing" people for committing felonies. What happened to arresting them?

Just like the lawsuit in Pennsylvania that went nowhere? When are people going to realize our institutions are being assaulted by Musk and MAGA. The US is in a state of constitutional and national security crisis.
Billionaires are a global security issue.
Sued, but not arrested for oh I don’t know….breaking a 💩 load of laws 🤔

Why ask a court to block it preemptively? He’s just gonna say he was never going to do it, which is just admitting to fraud again but that forces you to file another separate lawsuit. 

Show up, watch him hand out the checks, then immediately arrest him for election fraud. It’s that fucking simple, and governments arrest people for election fraud all the time.

posts.title: Elon Musk must face Twitter shareholders’ lawsuit over alleged securities fraud
top_comments:
"Musk’s attorneys have argued that while his disclosure was filed after an SEC-mandated deadline, this was merely an error and that the tech magnate did not commit nor intend securities fraud."

Look your honor, I may be a simple a simple country hyper-chicken, but my client did not intend to commit securities fraud, just did.

I like how Musk portrays himself as the most detail-oriented guy when trying to pretend like he knows what the fuck is going on with SpaceX rockets but then he commits an "oopsie" like this. As if he doesn't have somebody on his staff who's job is to deal with this.

Never knew this detail:




"In his 43-page opinion, the judge also noted that Musk had posted a tweet on March 26, 2022 indicating he was thinking about buying a different social network, not Twitter, although he had already amassed millions of shares in Twitter as of March 25, 2022.

He wrote, it was “reasonable” to read Musk’s tweet “as a statement meant to misdirect the public to think that buying Twitter was just a fantasy.” The judge also wrote that, “it is more likely than not that Musk issued a material misleading representation,” with those tweets.

Musk ultimately bid on and led a leveraged buyout of Twitter in 2022 in a deal worth about $44 billion. He made sweeping changes to the business, the social platform and later renamed it X."
I get the feeling that lawsuits against Musk won't amount to much. Buying the last election is really paying out for him.
"In the wallet" is his weak point.
It was announced today DOGE was going through onboarding with the SEC. So this will be dismissed at some point
Not if he destroys the justice system first.

This has to be why 🍑🍑 pardoned that other guy today… lying to investors to get money is just what these amoral people do, and they have no qualms about using the “if you’re stupid enough to believe me then it’s your own fault” mentality.  They have no business whatsoever being in the Oval Office, too bad their voters cannot seem to see past their aggrieved mentality to see that.
That turd needs to face all the people he’s screwing over.
I wonder how this will go, now that Musk has committed 30bn to the fire by 'buying it' with xAI donor money.

posts.title: Woman Arrested After Miscarriage In Georgia Under Abortion Law
top_comments: You know what will help that person deal with the trauma of a miscarriage? The trauma of an arrest. That will surely improve her life /s

"*What Should Women Who Miscarry Do?: We asked several Tifton Police Department and Tift County officials what women who miscarry should do with the remains of the fetus. So far, only Tift District Attorney Patrick Warren has answered and said typically miscarriages are not handled in this manner.*"

So they asked what she was supposed to do with the fetus and nobody had an answer.  If you can't tell her what she did wrong, why was she arrested?  Just because she probably didn't have a healthcare plan that would pay for it?

"The coroner’s office ruled it to be a occurring miscarriage"

I don't know if there's an official procedure of what to do with remains of a child when you have a miscarriage, but to jail and punish a mother for having one?   I mean... it's a miscarriage.  Did they want her to keep it in the fridge until the damn coroner can pick it up or something? Geeze! It's already traumatizing enough.
People wonder why from the 1950s-70s why women hid miscarriages? This right here.

What was she supposed to do with a dead fetus? At 19 weeks it was not close to viable. Women have been arrested for burying their stillborn children. Women miscarrying get turned away from hospitals because doctors are afraid to be accused of performing abortions. Maybe she didn’t even have the money to afford the ER visit (a whole other issue about how shitty the US is about healthcare).

Look, I’ll be real with you. I used to work with animal control. Laws are different in different places, but when we had dead animals the law was two trash bags, into the dumpster. Trash bag/dumpster seems better to me than flushing it down the toilet. Burying it in the yard like a dead pet? If there are no laws regarding this, Tifton needs to leave this woman alone.

Hey, remember when all the hippies were like "these laws are going to be used to criminalize miscarriages!" and the republicans were all "nah, not us!" and the hippies were right, just like we always are?

I have suffered from 2 miscarriages and I can say with absolute certainty that if, while healing physically and emotionally from a miscarriage, I had also been arrested for said miscarriage I would be ready to burn everything down.  I can also say with absolute  certainty that I still have not emotionally healed from my miscarriages, and neither has my husband.  It's one of those things where you never actually get over it, but time makes it easier to go about your day.  This is heartbreaking and chilling and I wish this woman infinite strength.

Oh, look. That thing that women were told not to worry about happening has happened.

  
They want to criminalize women for not being perfect broodmares.

Another article on the same topic. This is not an isolated case


https://www.jezebel.com/georgia-police-jailed-woman-for-miscarriage-performed-autopsy-on-miscarried-fetus
Nothing says family values and traditionalism like arresting a mother for a miscarriage she had no control over whatsoever /s

We haven't even started feeling the effects of the tariffs and the feds yanking billions of dollars of spending out of the economy, unemployment is going to spike with all the layoffs over the last couple of months, and inflation is taking off again.

I've moved mostly into cash. I keep hearing people repeat a dumb slogan: "Time in the market > timing the market!!!" Maybe that's true sometimes, but not times like now where there is literally zero reason for the market to go up, and a zillion reasons it will continue going down.

posts.title: Collision warning sounds in cockpit of Delta plane due to close call with Air Force jet near Reagan National Airport
top_comments: You know what . . . I think I'm shifting to Dulles as my main DC airport from now on.
This happened near the spot of the fatal plane collision 2 months ago.
so are they just not gonna do anything about the horrifically congested airspace in DC
They should introduce some kind of incentive to avoid these kinds of mishaps.

Normal rules in the US limit aircraft that are flying below 10,000 ft to an airspeed of 250knots (roughly 304 MPH). The t-38 is a training jet (hence the T for training).

Why was the military trainer jet flying so fast in busy airspace? We have plenty of other military designated training ranges to learn to fly fast in.
I'm sure Pete Hegseth will see to this very quick-- ah nevermind. Good fucking luck, America.
Why are they using commercial jets for training obstacles? Unconscionable.
Jebus! I flew in and out of DCA two hours ago. WTF

'...a review of tracking data from FlightRadar24 shows an Air Force T-38 jet flying past the Delta plane and DCA airport going more than *350 miles per hour at 800 feet*. The military jet took off and landed at Langley Air Force Base, in Hampton, Virginia.'

*(emphasis* mine)
Cool.  So my anxiety I had just this evening flying into DCA wasn’t totally unfounded.  I’m glad I didn’t read this before we left.

posts.title: The Vermont Bar Association supports the Rule of Law, issues statement.
top_comments:
“The VBA condemns acts that undermine our democratic checks and balances and denounces attacks upon the judiciary. We express our unwavering support for an independent judiciary. Respect for the rule of law is essential to the functioning of our democratic society, justice, and the protection of individual rights and liberties. Everyone stands subject and accountable to the law. We remain committed to ensuring all Vermonters have access to the judicial process and that the process remains fair and equitable.”
Now let’s see this principle be enforced.
Please forward thid story to your state and local bar association.
Can you believe this even needs to be said.
It's sad that they have to come out with a statement like this.
Isn’t this just a mission statement affirmation before their annual meeting, or do you have more context? I imagine we could speculate, but the linked information is pretty standard and generic.

posts.title: Blackpool doctor not struck off by panel over 'one-off' rape
top_comments:
- Police investigated the incident but did not charge the doctor.
- The doctor denies the allegations.
- The incident had not taken place at his workplace.
- The alleged victim was not a patient.
- According to the tribunal, the doctor has not abused his position of trust as a doctor, and the incident did not involve patient safety concerns.


Despite all of that the tribunal still suspended the doctor for 12 months, and he no longer works at the place he used to work.


Both the General Medical Council as well as the doctor have appealed the decision of the tribunal.

Many here just don't know that General Medical Council, the UK medical body, is very controversial within the UK medical professional. Unlike many doctors councils in the world, they are not led by doctors by civilians. 

They are already said by a judge to be racist and pretty much hated by doctors in UK due to questionable practice.

wtf 

“You get one strike. Don’t do it again”. 

Sick
it's never "one-off". People who rape are serial rapists almost every single time.
BBC has now joined the click bait club

"It's OK of you do it only once and have said you are sorry."   
Noted.
I guess they’re waiting for him to commit a “two off.”

Sounds like they should one of goto jail
For 20+ years.

posts.title: Denmark Weighs Expanding Its Fleet of US F-35 Fighters Despite Tensions over Greenland
top_comments:
The only way F35 has a future in Europe is if they get the same independent system as Israel has. 

The problem is bigger than just F35. A lot of weapons (even European weapon systems) rely on American communication protocols, satalites, infrastructure. 

https://global4cast.org/2025/02/kill-switch-how-the-u-s-can-shut-down-europes-military-in-an-instant/

This is 100% not confirmed or set in stone at all in any way. Our deference minster said: "We have to strengthen our fleet of fighter jets and it is completely logical to acquire more F-35 fighter jets,"

There is also some posturing happening at the moment to not upset the Americans. It would cause more harm than good to say "Thanks for the F-35 but we would never consider buying them again, because we only want to support European" right after JD Vance called us a bad ally. Pathetic, I know but gotta use all the tricks in the book to not upset grandpa Donny.
Sounds like a default hard no to me, what’s there to consider buying then anyway? The US does have the ability to limit the support and updates of these jets, limiting their functionality.
Nothing is signed. Its a bargaining chip

Well they're "weighting" it but it might be a matter of negotiations with other manufacturers at this point. If you completely and openly rule out the competition, you might not have a good deal... business is business after all
Knowing Donny Do Wrong, he'll probably accept selling planes to Denmark while also threatening war with them.... because he's a fucking stupid fuck.
Daft idea. It's not a reliable platform.
Jfc Denmark, if there ever was a time to switch to Swedish or French planes, this would be the moment (both cheaper and better, too)
US says it’s gonna take over Greenland, so in response Denmark buys a bunch of expensive planes made in US? Lockheed wins again.

The concerns about the US being unreliable are well founded at this point.  The US really needs to switch to selecting leaders using randomocracy - instead of elections reps, senators, etc are selected by lottery from among all eligible citizens.  It would produce a govt that is statistically far more representative of the population, resulting in less violent swings between successive govts.  It would also greatly diminish the power of political parties, reducing the insane partisanship that brought us to the present moment.

posts.title: Elon Musk must face Twitter shareholders’ lawsuit over alleged securities fraud
top_comments:
"Musk’s attorneys have argued that while his disclosure was filed after an SEC-mandated deadline, this was merely an error and that the tech magnate did not commit nor intend securities fraud."

Look your honor, I may be a simple a simple country hyper-chicken, but my client did not intend to commit securities fraud, just did.

I like how Musk portrays himself as the most detail-oriented guy when trying to pretend like he knows what the fuck is going on with SpaceX rockets but then he commits an "oopsie" like this. As if he doesn't have somebody on his staff who's job is to deal with this.

Never knew this detail:




"In his 43-page opinion, the judge also noted that Musk had posted a tweet on March 26, 2022 indicating he was thinking about buying a different social network, not Twitter, although he had already amassed millions of shares in Twitter as of March 25, 2022.

He wrote, it was “reasonable” to read Musk’s tweet “as a statement meant to misdirect the public to think that buying Twitter was just a fantasy.” The judge also wrote that, “it is more likely than not that Musk issued a material misleading representation,” with those tweets.

Musk ultimately bid on and led a leveraged buyout of Twitter in 2022 in a deal worth about $44 billion. He made sweeping changes to the business, the social platform and later renamed it X."

posts.title: Elon Musk must face Twitter shareholders’ lawsuit over alleged securities fraud
top_comments:
"Musk’s attorneys have argued that while his disclosure was filed after an SEC-mandated deadline, this was merely an error and that the tech magnate did not commit nor intend securities fraud."

Look your honor, I may be a simple a simple country hyper-chicken, but my client did not intend to commit securities fraud, just did.

I like how Musk portrays himself as the most detail-oriented guy when trying to pretend like he knows what the fuck is going on with SpaceX rockets but then he commits an "oopsie" like this. As if he doesn't have somebody on his staff who's job is to deal with this.

Never knew this detail:




"In his 43-page opinion, the judge also noted that Musk had posted a tweet on March 26, 2022 indicating he was thinking about buying a different social network, not Twitter, although he had already amassed millions of shares in Twitter as of March 25, 2022.

He wrote, it was “reasonable” to read Musk’s tweet “as a statement meant to misdirect the public to think that buying Twitter was just a fantasy.” The judge also wrote that, “it is more likely than not that Musk issued a material misleading representation,” with those tweets.

Musk ultimately bid on and led a leveraged buyout of Twitter in 2022 in a deal worth about $44 billion. He made sweeping changes to the business, the social platform and later renamed it X."
I get the feeling that lawsuits against Musk won't amount to much. Buying the last election is really paying out for him.
"In the wallet" is his weak point.
It was announced today DOGE was going through onboarding with the SEC. So this will be dismissed at some point
Not if he destroys the justice system first.

This has to be why 🍑🍑 pardoned that other guy today… lying to investors to get money is just what these amoral people do, and they have no qualms about using the “if you’re stupid enough to believe me then it’s your own fault” mentality.  They have no business whatsoever being in the Oval Office, too bad their voters cannot seem to see past their aggrieved mentality to see that.
That turd needs to face all the people he’s screwing over.
I wonder how this will go, now that Musk has committed 30bn to the fire by 'buying it' with xAI donor money.

posts.title: Collision warning sounds in cockpit of Delta plane due to close call with Air Force jet near Reagan National Airport
top_comments: You know what . . . I think I'm shifting to Dulles as my main DC airport from now on.
This happened near the spot of the fatal plane collision 2 months ago.
so are they just not gonna do anything about the horrifically congested airspace in DC
They should introduce some kind of incentive to avoid these kinds of mishaps.

Normal rules in the US limit aircraft that are flying below 10,000 ft to an airspeed of 250knots (roughly 304 MPH). The t-38 is a training jet (hence the T for training).

Why was the military trainer jet flying so fast in busy airspace? We have plenty of other military designated training ranges to learn to fly fast in.
I'm sure Pete Hegseth will see to this very quick-- ah nevermind. Good fucking luck, America.
Why are they using commercial jets for training obstacles? Unconscionable.
Jebus! I flew in and out of DCA two hours ago. WTF

'...a review of tracking data from FlightRadar24 shows an Air Force T-38 jet flying past the Delta plane and DCA airport going more than *350 miles per hour at 800 feet*. The military jet took off and landed at Langley Air Force Base, in Hampton, Virginia.'

*(emphasis* mine)
Cool.  So my anxiety I had just this evening flying into DCA wasn’t totally unfounded.  I’m glad I didn’t read this before we left.

top_comments:

>*Ms. Petrova's situation is especially dire because the U.S. government is now seeking to deport her to Russia, where she faces the threat of immediate arrest due to her prior political activism and outspoken opposition to Russia's invasion of Ukraine*

Normally such threat would actually be a reason for asylum, but...

...embryos are persons now, thus .... no normal things to be expected soon.

Someone make all of this make sense.

Before US have been riding on their scientific institutions generally paying higher salaries than competing institutions elsewhere, but a better salary is not worth being thrown into an ICE concentration camp.
Yes, it can be a pain to import biologicals, but to do this in this environment speaks either to her scientific dedication or hubris.

posts.title: Elon Musk sued by Wisconsin attorney general ahead of state election - CBS Minnesota
top_comments:
In another article

> Wisconsin Attorney General Josh Kaul sued Musk in state court, seeking to temporarily restrain Musk from further promoting his promise to give away two $1 million checks or making any further payments to Wisconsin voters. Wisconsin law prohibits offering anything of value to an elector in order to induce their voting behavior, Kaul said in the Dane County Circuit Court lawsuit.
“The Wisconsin Department of Justice is committed to ensuring that elections in Wisconsin are safe, secure, free, and fair,” Kaul said in a statement on X.

Like holy cow can someone please charge this man with election interference.
Cool. Now, convict and JAIL THIS MOTHERFUCKER.

This is exactly why billionaires shouldn't exist. There is nothing respectable or admirable about this, there is no advanced strategy or genius-level 4D Chess, absolutely no hard work is going into any of these victories, they are simply throwing money at the problem like always and it always works for them cause they keep us destitute.
Remember what life was like before this piece of shit was front and center in the news every fucking day? That was nice.

Unfortunately we’ve already seen the ultra wealthy can’t be held accountable because they can just delay delay delay forever.

Good luck to them either way.

Just like the lawsuit in Pennsylvania that went nowhere? When are people going to realize our institutions are being assaulted by Musk and MAGA. The US is in a state of constitutional and national security crisis.
Billionaires are a global security issue.
Sued, but not arrested for oh I don’t know….breaking a 💩 load of laws 🤔

posts.title: Woman Arrested After Miscarriage In Georgia Under Abortion Law
top_comments: You know what will help that person deal with the trauma of a miscarriage? The trauma of an arrest. That will surely improve her life /s

"*What Should Women Who Miscarry Do?: We asked several Tifton Police Department and Tift County officials what women who miscarry should do with the remains of the fetus. So far, only Tift District Attorney Patrick Warren has answered and said typically miscarriages are not handled in this manner.*"

So they asked what she was supposed to do with the fetus and nobody had an answer.  If you can't tell her what she did wrong, why was she arrested?  Just because she probably didn't have a healthcare plan that would pay for it?

"The coroner’s office ruled it to be a occurring miscarriage"

I don't know if there's an official procedure of what to do with remains of a child when you have a miscarriage, but to jail and punish a mother for having one?   I mean... it's a miscarriage.  Did they want her to keep it in the fridge until the damn coroner can pick it up or something? Geeze! It's already traumatizing enough.
People wonder why from the 1950s-70s why women hid miscarriages? This right here.

What was she supposed to do with a dead fetus? At 19 weeks it was not close to viable. Women have been arrested for burying their stillborn children. Women miscarrying get turned away from hospitals because doctors are afraid to be accused of performing abortions. Maybe she didn’t even have the money to afford the ER visit (a whole other issue about how shitty the US is about healthcare).

Look, I’ll be real with you. I used to work with animal control. Laws are different in different places, but when we had dead animals the law was two trash bags, into the dumpster. Trash bag/dumpster seems better to me than flushing it down the toilet. Burying it in the yard like a dead pet? If there are no laws regarding this, Tifton needs to leave this woman alone.

Hey, remember when all the hippies were like "these laws are going to be used to criminalize miscarriages!" and the republicans were all "nah, not us!" and the hippies were right, just like we always are?

I have suffered from 2 miscarriages and I can say with absolute certainty that if, while healing physically and emotionally from a miscarriage, I had also been arrested for said miscarriage I would be ready to burn everything down.  I can also say with absolute  certainty that I still have not emotionally healed from my miscarriages, and neither has my husband.  It's one of those things where you never actually get over it, but time makes it easier to go about your day.  This is heartbreaking and chilling and I wish this woman infinite strength.

Oh, look. That thing that women were told not to worry about happening has happened.

  
They want to criminalize women for not being perfect broodmares.

Another article on the same topic. This is not an isolated case


https://www.jezebel.com/georgia-police-jailed-woman-for-miscarriage-performed-autopsy-on-miscarried-fetus
Nothing says family values and traditionalism like arresting a mother for a miscarriage she had no control over whatsoever /s
